clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Ankle-foot Orthoses on Balance Confidence
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Ankle-foot Orthoses on Patients' Confidence in Balance-related Activities

lead_sponsor.agency: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

clinical_study.source: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

brief_summary.textblock: The patients at our Prosthetics and Orthotics Outpatient Clinic who have had an ankle-foot orthosis for at least one year will fill in the Activities-Specific Balance Confidence Scale (ABC Scale) for wearing the orthosis and for not wearing the orthosis. They will also answer a mini survey about falls in order to determine whether they have fallen within the last 6 months.

detailed_description.textblock: The effect of the orthosis will be estimated as the difference between the two ABC Scale scores. The ABC Scale score and individual items will be compared between the fallers and the non-fallers.

primary_outcome.description: Activities-Specific Balance Confidence Scale (ABC Scale) will be filled in for the confidence without the orthosis and confidence with the orthosis. The ABC Scale is a 16-item self-report measure in which patients rate their balance confidence for performing activities. Each item is rated on a scale from 0 (no confidence) to 100 (complete confidence). Overall score is the average rating across the items.

arm_group.description: The patients who had fallen during the 6 months prior to the study onset
The patients who had not fallen during the 6 months prior to the study onset

intervention.description: Ankle-foot orthosis of any type (unilateral or bilateral, standard or carbon fiber, for support or correction)

study_pop.textblock: All the patients of our Prosthetics and Orthotics Outpatient Clinic who have had an ankle-foot orthosis for at least 1 year and able to fill in the ABC Scale

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients at our Prosthetics and Orthotics Outpatient Clinic having an ankle-foot orthosis for at least 1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
- insufficient cognitive ability to fill in the ABC Scale
